website_summaries.verdict: The Peregrine 8 ICE+ is a trail running shoe designed to survive snowy mountain runs. Though few users are not satisfied with the shoe’s sizing and quality, it still makes some runners happy because of its water-resistant coverage, comfort, and lightweight design. Overall, the Peregrine 8 Ice+ proved to be an efficient runner with promising qualities.
pros: The Saucony Peregrine 8 ICE+ is a comfortable running shoe, said some runners
A couple of users are delighted by the shoe’s lightweight construction
Most purchasers admired the durable traction of the Peregrine 8 ICE+
The water-resistant upper works effectively in keeping feet dry throughout the run, a few users noted
Several runners highlighted the shoes’ warm coverage
making it ideal for winter running
cons: The Saucony Peregrine 8 ICE+ is a bit expensive
A few wearers were disappointed because of the shoe’s poor quality

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about this shoe for winter activities in my experience. Used on ice, slush, snow and wet dirt trails during the months of November and December along the Wasatch Front in Utah. Found no real benefit compared to regular shoes. I am comparing to a Altra lone peak. CONS Not waterproof at all Cold toes Snow grip is poor Ice grip not any better than regular shoes
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Ice/Snow Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 in NB and, after previous reviews, went with a 10.5. Perfect fit. Avg toe box with extra wide support from tread, great heel control. The added insulation around the ankle is amazing and doesn’t add any pressure on soft tissue. Good breathability for the water resistance. The tread has excellent traction. Chevrons with multiple rubber conglomerates. Amazing shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Won't be wearing this often.
customer_reviews.text: The Vibram Arctic Ice sole grips as expected. But toe box is narrow, pinching and sole has 4mm drop. I am used to Altra which has a wide toe box and zero drop. The Saucony heel height makes my back muscles tighten up. Altras don't. Wish Altra would offer something with more water resistance and the Arctic Ice grip. These Sauconys might last me a long time because I will wear them only on special occasions when conditions make the cons tolerable. But they might save me from busting my butt on ice.
customer_reviews.author: TuffMucker

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could use improvements.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit in general but they could use more insulation, and traction. They are kind of sold as a winter show but your feet will be cold in ~20 minutes of non-movement. Traction is better than most shoes but still kind of "ok". Not as tight fitting as UA or NIKE shoes so that's why I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for wet and slippery winter weather conditions!
customer_reviews.text: After wearing out my pair over the winter of 2018-19, I sought out an identical pair because of the excellent performance I received in snow, slush, and ice. I've already gotten to use the new pair in those same conditions and it's not even winter yet!
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Super warm and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I run every day outside in Minnesota, and this is the first year my feet didn’t get cold. The toe box is super warm and snow doesn’t get in unless you’re running in really deep snow. Not for all year use, they’d be too warm.
customer_reviews.author: Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit very well and perform on snow and ice excellently! I prefer to run outdoors year round over using excellent the treadmill. We live in Michigan...there’s 4 months of winter. Today I ran 7 miles in fresh snow and ice. Didn’t slip once. I highly recommend these shoes for safe winter running.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: good grip on shear ice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a recreational broom ball league at my school and they give me really good traction on the slickest ice. Also the waterproofing is good enough for playing broom ball, I just played five games in a row and my feet are perfectly dry but the shoes look damp. These shoes allow me to get going and stop faster on ice than any other shoes I have tried. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable ice and snow running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable running shoes for using on ice and snow. They have good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe good looks too
customer_reviews.text: Great styling and colors. Excellent fit and great traction for hiking in any conditions.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for winter
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, warmer than my other shoes and less slippery on ice.
customer_reviews.author: J. T.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good show for the price . Most other similar 40 or 50 bucks more
customer_reviews.author: Love not leaving the house

customer_reviews.title: Great on Snow and Ice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for walking on ice and snowy conditions. Unique tread makes feel feel comfortable walking in less than ideal conditions. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Epic
customer_reviews.text: Epic. I live in Chicago and use these for the nasty slushy days. Feet have been dry!
customer_reviews.author: Gamer Dad

customer_reviews.title: Winter runner
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Slightly bulky but understandable because they are quite warm.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Dusseau

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd pair of Peregrine Ice
customer_reviews.text: One of the best shoes for snowy winters. But remember it doesn't work when there is nasty ice on roads.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but slightly different widths
customer_reviews.text: A little tight just before the toes only on one foot. Not significantly different between shoes. Grip treads work great.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Slavik

customer_reviews.title: Warmer than regular running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these less for the tread, which is fine, I mean, nothing is great on ice, but for snow and trails these work well; I really purchased them for their water resistance and warmer construction. My summer shoes with their breathable mesh construction are just toe numbingly cold in the winter. The Peregrine 8 ICE + are much warmer. They are narrow so if you want to run with an extra thick pair of socks maybe buy one size up from what you normally are.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Russia tested
customer_reviews.text: Warm, good grip. Neutral pronation. Smaller than my regular Sauconys though. Very happy that I took em relocating to Russia.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Peregrine 8 Ice+ Training Shoes, Black (Black/White 001), 7 UK
product_meta.description: The ceramic particles of the Vibram Arctic Grip outsole also ensure optimum grip on ice and make the Peregrine 8 ice+ your perfect partner even at temperatures under the freezing point. The Everun top sole provides optimal cushioning and energy recovery. Thanks to the multi-directional tri-flex outsole and its 6 mm deep profile, the Peregrine 8 ice+ is also your ideal running shoe for demanding surfaces. The trail-specific outer material also protects your foot in the countryside, so that you can gain uncared gas with our most dynamic trail shoe.
